contest-event.event-date:
Oct. 1, 1888 D Irish Exhibition Contest
Irish Exhibition Contest 0 Other Irish Exhibition Contest irish-exhibition-contest
Test Piece Contest
Pot Pourri (arr. Haydn Millars)
Olympia, West Kensington, Hammersmith and Fulham, Greater London, England, UK 20 bands entered, 6 competed. Prizes: £72 and £26 10s euphonium, £42 and £12 10s cornet, £15 See http://www.ibew.org.uk/misc17.htm http://www.studygroup.org.uk/Archives/25/1888%20IRISH%20EXHIBITION%20OLYMPIA.htm "In 1888 a competition was held at the Irish Exhibition, at which the prizes were awarded thus - First day - first prize, Wyke Old Brass Band, conducted by Mr. J. Gladney; second prize, Leeds Forge Band, Mr. E. Swift; third prize, Wyke Temperance Band, Mr. E. Swift. Second day - first prize, Staleybridge Borough Band, Mr. A. Owen; Linthwaite Band; Mr. J. S. Jones; Rushden Temperance Silver Prize Band, Mr. G. F. Birkinshaw. "
Jan. 3, 2012, 2:03 p.m. May 19, 2019, 10:09 a.m.
